article.title: Aerobic Exercise and Pharmacological Treatments Counteract Cachexia by Modulating Autophagy in Colon Cancer

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the effect of voluntary wheel running (WR) on TA muscle weight in C26-bearing mice?
choices: No effect
Increases TA muscle weight
Decreases TA muscle weight
Causes hypertrophy in all muscle groups

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the relationship between running distance and life span in C26-bearing mice, as shown in Figure 1f?
choices: There is no relationship.
Increased running distance is associated with decreased life span.
Increased running distance is associated with increased life span.
Maximum running distance plateaus after 40 days.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the survival curve in Figure 1e indicate about the effect of WR on C26-bearing mice?
choices: WR has no effect on survival.
WR worsens survival.
WR improves survival.
WR causes a delay in tumor onset.

multiple_choice_question.text: What happens to the autophagic markers LC3bII/LC3bI and p62/Gapdh ratios in C26-bearing mice compared to control mice?
choices: They decrease.
They remain unchanged.
They increase.
LC3bII/LC3bI ratio increases, while p62/Gapdh ratio decreases.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the effect of voluntary wheel running (WR) on the expression of muscle-specific E3 ubiquitin ligases, Atrogin 1 and MuRF1, in C26-bearing mice?
choices: WR increases the expression of both ligases.
WR decreases the expression of both ligases.
WR increases Atrogin 1 but decreases MuRF1.
WR has no effect on the expression of either ligase.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 2f-h shows data from skeletal muscle biopsies of colon carcinoma patients and healthy subjects. What do these data suggest about autophagy in cancer cachexia?
choices: Autophagy is downregulated in cancer cachexia.
Autophagy is upregulated in cancer cachexia.
Autophagy levels are similar in cancer cachexia and healthy controls.
Autophagy plays no role in cancer cachexia.
